measured_by: single self-report question asking for an overall number of daily food and beverage decisions
justification: “Participants first provided an overall, global estimate of their daily food and beverage decisions, yielding an average of 14.4 decisions.”

measured_by: self-report questionnaire estimating counts for 'when', 'what', 'how much', 'where', and 'with whom' per eating occasion, then summed
justification: “They were asked to estimate the number of ‘when,’ ‘what,’ ‘how much,’ ‘where,’ and ‘with whom’ decisions… These estimates were multiplied… and summed, yielding… 226.7 decisions.”

measured_by: difference between unpacked estimate and global estimate of daily food decisions
justification: “The difference between the two estimates, 212.3, was interpreted as representing the number of overlooked—dubbed ‘mindless’—decisions made each day.”

measured_by: observational count of bite-sized pieces of food eaten
justification: “Dallacker et al. (2023)… operationalized decisions as bite-sized pieces of food eaten.”
construct: children’s food intake decisions during family meals

measured_by: USDA FoodAPS survey of food purchases and acquisitions over one week
justification: “the USDA Economic Research Service (2019) assessed household food purchases and acquisitions over a one-week period.”

measured_by: coded fridge door opening events captured on video over two weeks
justification: “Elias et al. (2007, 2009) videotaped fridge door openings… They identified and coded fridge door openings and the decision taken.”
